quote: Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it.
No feeling is final.
Don’t compromise yourself. You are all you’ve got.
You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
Never, never, never, never, never give up.

Watch your thoughts; they become your words. Watch your words; they become your actions. Watch your actions; they become your habits. Watch your habits; they become your character. Watch your character; it becomes your destiny.
Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
Let your heart guide you. It whispers, so listen closely.

Life is never what one dreams. It is seldom what one desires, but for the vital spirit and the eager mind, the future will always hold the search for buried treasure and the possibility of high adventure.
It takes two to speak the truth—one to speak, the other to hear.

When you do a thing, do it with all your might. Put your whole soul into it. Stamp it with your personality. Be active, be energetic, be enthusiastic and faithful, and you will accomplish your object.
The future depends on what we do in the present.
A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
Each of us is two selves, and the great challenge of life is to try to keep that higher self in command.
Life is not what it’s supposed to be. It’s what it is. The way you cope with it is what makes the difference.
The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person's determination.
Remember there's no such thing as a small act of kindness. Every act creates a ripple with no logical end.
Follow your honest convictions, and stay strong.
Your real influence is measured by your treatment of yourself.
Fear less, hope more, eat less, chew more, whine less, breathe more, talk less, say more, hate less, love more, and good things will be yours.
I have learned that the greater part of our misery or unhappiness is determined not by our circumstance but by our disposition.
Every day do something that will inch you closer to a better tomorrow.
The happiest life is that which constantly exercises and educates what is best in us.
If we all did the things we are capable of, we would astound ourselves.

Don't waste your life in doubts and fears: spend yourself on the work before you, well assured that the right performance of this hour's duties will be the best preparation for the hours or ages that follow it.
When one door of happiness closes, another opens, but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one that has been opened for us.
If you do not hope, you will not find what is beyond your hopes.
I can be changed by what happens to me, but I refuse to be reduced by it.
Healing takes courage, and we all have courage, even if we have to dig a little to find it.
Faith is taking the first step even when you don’t see the whole staircase.
She never seemed shattered; to me, she was a breathtaking mosaic of the battles she’s won.
We must build dikes of courage to hold back the flood of fear.
She was powerful, not because she wasn’t scared, but because she went so strongly, despite the fear.
Trauma creates change you DON’T choose. Healing is about creating change you DO choose.
Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
We do not heal the past by dwelling there; we heal the past by living fully in the present.
What version of yourself do you want to be?
Things done well, and with a care, exempt themselves from fear.
Human kindness has never weakened the stamina or softened the fiber of a free people. A nation does not have to be cruel in order to be tough.
In the midst of this crisis, we must not only pray-though we must most fervently pray-we must also work. There are many things to be done and it’s going to be up to us to do them.

attribution: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
quote: See you on Thursday.
We are a nation equally afraid of gathering together and being alone.
We will understand our own importance from the places we must stay. Communion moves beyond walls. We can still be together.
I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
When we speak we are afraid our words will not be heard or welcomed. But when we are silent, we are still afraid. So it is better to speak.
In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.
The older I get, the more I'm conscious of ways very small things can make a change in the world. Tiny little things, but the world is made up of tiny matters, isn't it?
Fall seven times and stand up eight.
Like a welcome summer rain, humor may suddenly cleanse and cool the earth, the air and you.
Resilience is, of course, necessary for a warrior. But a lack of empathy isn't.
If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.

There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition, and of unspeakable love.
Do what you can, where you are, with what you have.
If at all possible, stay home.
In these times of hardship, just remember: We are Groot.
The best way out is always through..
You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep Spring from coming.
Walk on with hope in your heart, and you'll never walk alone
Where there is no hope, it is incumbent on us to invent it.
The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof.
Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness.
You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.
I am no longer accepting the things I cannot change. I am changing the thing I cannot accept.
What you do makes a difference. And you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.
People often say that beauty is in the eye of the beholder, and I say that the most liberating thing about beauty is realizing that you are the beholder.
What is fundamentally beautiful is compassion, for yourself and for those around you. That kind of beauty enflames the heart and enchants the soul.
Now that I knew fear, I also knew it was not permanent. As powerful as it was, its grip on me would loosen. It would pass.
There are opportunities even in the most difficult moments.

If you wish to heal your sadness or anger, seek to heal the sadness or anger of others. They are looking to you for guidance, help, courage, strength, understanding, and for assurance. Most of all, they are looking to you for love.
The pain you feel today is the strength you feel tomorrow.
Rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I built my life.
The soul always knows what to do to heal itself. The challenge is to silence the mind.
If you are going through hell, keep going.
I am not what happens to me. I am what I choose to become.
When the world says, "Give up." Hope whispers, "Try it one more time."
Never be ashamed of a scar. It simply means you were stronger than whatever tried to hurt you.
Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart.
I don’t know a perfect person. I only know flawed people who are still worth loving.
Don't try to steer the river.
Remember. Hope is a good thing. Maybe the best of things. And no good thing ever dies.
Strength doesn't come from what you can do. It comes from overcoming the things you once thought you couldn't.
I am better off healed than I ever was unbroken.
Storms make trees take deeper roots.
We cannot direct the wind, but we can adjust the sails.
The way I see it, if you want the rainbow, you gotta put up with the rain.
Real change, enduring change, happens one step at a time.
There is always light, if only we're brave enough to see it. If only we're brave enough to be it.
